headline: Youth missing after falling from kayak at Pictou County lake | CBC News
context: Police and other agencies are searching for a youth who is missing after falling into the water while kayaking Thursday at a lake in Nova Scotiaâ€™s Pictou County.

annotations.paragraph: Youth missing after falling from kayak at Pictou County lake
annotations.reason: This is the headline and does not provide new information.

annotations.paragraph: Police and other agencies are searching for a youth who is missing after falling into the water while kayaking Thursday at a lake in Nova Scotia's Pictou County, according to RCMP.
annotations.reason: This paragraph provides essential information about the search for the missing youth.

annotations.paragraph: An RCMP spokesperson said in an email Friday the search is at Eden Lake, which is about 30 kilometres southeast of New Glasgow. The spokesperson did not give the age of the person.
annotations.reason: This paragraph provides specific details about the location of the search.

annotations.paragraph: The spokesperson urged people not to go to the area to allow searchers to do their work.
annotations.reason: This paragraph provides relevant information about the search efforts and public safety.

annotations.paragraph: A media release later Friday said Pictou County District RCMP, fire services and EHS were dispatched on Thursday at 5 p.m. to a report of an incident at Eden Lake.
annotations.reason: This paragraph provides a timeline and details about the emergency response.

annotations.paragraph: According to the release, RCMP officers learned that two youths who were known to one another were paddling on the lake in separate kayaks when one of the kayaks overturned.
annotations.reason: This paragraph provides details about the incident, specifically how the youth went missing.

annotations.paragraph: Fire services, ground search and rescue teams, a Department of Natural Resources helicopter, the Civil Air Search and Rescue Association, RCMP air services and the RCMP underwater recovery team have participated in the search.
annotations.reason: This paragraph lists the agencies involved in the search, contributing to the understanding of the search efforts.
This is a navigation prompt and does not contribute to the story.
